question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Function: get_latest_version()] [Stale Read] Can an attacker exploit the timing between when get_latest_version() reads and when cache data is accessed to serve stale transactions, potentially causing indexer clients to miss recent blocks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Lines: 145-147] [Missing Atomicity] Does get_latest_version() guarantee atomic reads with subsequent data fetches, or can the version change between the read and data access causing version mismatch errors? (High)
